content: Graduate Software Engineering students at the University of Arizona can use a set of approved 500-level SIE, SFWE, and ECE courses as technical electives. MS students use these to reach the 30-unit minimum, and PhD students apply them toward the required 16 units of non-dissertation coursework, subject to advisor and Graduate Studies approval.

metadata.document_title: MS/PhD Software Engineering Graduate Technical Electives
metadata.ms_requirement: MS students must complete required core courses plus technical electives to reach 30 units minimum
metadata.phd_requirement: PhD students must complete 16 units of non-dissertation coursework approved by faculty advisor and Director of Graduate Studies
important_notes: * indicates core courses that can be used as technical electives if not used to meet core requirements
** indicates courses with specific prerequisite requirements - see prerequisites sheet for details

content: SIE 577 Introduction to Biomedical Informatics (3 units) is an approved graduate technical elective that covers biomedical informatics topics for MS and PhD Software Engineering students.
SIE 571 Systems Cyber Security Engineering (3 units) is a graduate technical elective focusing on cybersecurity aspects of systems engineering, available to MS and PhD Software Engineering students.
SIE 558 Model Based Systems Engineering (3 units) is an approved technical elective covering model-based approaches to systems engineering for MS and PhD Software Engineering students.

SIE 533 Fundamentals of Data Science for Engineers (3 units) is a graduate technical elective introducing data science methods for engineering applications, applicable to MS and PhD Software Engineering plans of study.

metadata.course_title: Fund of Data Science for Engineers

content: SIE 531 Simulation Modeling & Analysis (3 units) is an approved technical elective covering simulation modeling and analysis techniques for MS and PhD Software Engineering students.
SIE 530 Engineering Statistics (3 units) is a graduate technical elective that provides statistical methods for engineering analysis for MS and PhD Software Engineering students.
SIE 515 Technical Sales & Marketing (3 units) is an approved technical elective that explores sales and marketing concepts in technical environments for graduate Software Engineering students.
SIE 554A The Systems Engineering Process (3 units) is an approved technical elective covering the systems engineering lifecycle for MS and PhD Software Engineering students.
SFWE 501 Software Assurance (3 units) is a graduate Software Engineering technical elective that focuses on assuring software quality and reliability.
SFWE 502 Software DevSecOps (4 units) is a core-eligible course that can also be used as a technical elective; it covers DevSecOps practices integrating development, security, and operations.
SFWE 503 Software Project Management (3 units) is a core-eligible course that can count as a technical elective when not used for the core, focusing on managing software projects and teams.

metadata.prerequisites: SFWE 302(Software Architecture & Design) Recommended prior to enrollment.

content: SFWE 504 Software Requirements Analysis & Test (3 units) is a core-eligible course emphasizing requirements engineering and software testing; it may be used as a technical elective if not applied to the core.

metadata.prerequisites: Prerequisite or concurrent enrollment in SFWE 507.

content: SFWE 505 Software Architecture & Design (3 units) is a core-eligible course focused on architectural styles and design techniques, and can serve as a technical elective when not counted toward core requirements.
SFWE 509 Cloud Computing Principles and Practices (3 units) is a technical elective covering cloud architectures and systems; it can also satisfy core requirements if allowed by the plan of study.

metadata.prerequisites: ECE 369A or CSC 252 required. Prior knowledge in data structures, operating systems, distributed systems, and computer networks is recommended.

content: SFWE 510 Cloud Native Software Engineering (3 units) is a technical elective, and core-eligible, focusing on designing and building cloud-native software systems.

metadata.prerequisites: SFWE 302(Software Architecture & Design) Recommended prior to enrollment.

content: SFWE 511 Software for Industrial Control Systems (3 units) is a graduate technical elective covering software for industrial and control applications.
SFWE 506 Distributed Computing (3 units) is a core-eligible course in distributed systems that can also be counted as a technical elective when not applied to the core.
SFWE 513 Software Engineering Research Methods (3 units) is a graduate technical elective that prepares students for research in Software Engineering.
ECE 579 Artificial Intelligence (3 units) is an approved graduate technical elective covering AI techniques relevant to Software Engineering research and applications.
ECE 503 Probability and Random Processes for Engineering Applications (3 units) is a graduate technical elective that provides probabilistic and stochastic foundations for engineering analysis.

metadata.course_title: Probability and Random Processes for Engineering Applications

content: ECE 513 Web Development & the IoT (3 units) is a technical elective that focuses on web technologies and Internet of Things applications.
ECE 523 Engineering Applications of Machine Learning and Data Analytics (3 units) is a graduate technical elective applying ML and data analytics in engineering contexts.

metadata.course_title: Engineering Applications of Machine Learning and Data Analytics

content: ECE 576A Engineering of Computer Based Systems (3 units) is an approved technical elective focusing on the engineering of complex computer-based systems.
ECE 562 Computer Architecture & Design (3 units) is a graduate technical elective covering advanced computer architecture and design topics.
ECE 576B Embedded System Desing and Optimization (3 units) is a technical elective dealing with design and optimization of embedded systems.
ECE 529 Digital Signal Processing (3 units) is an approved technical elective focusing on DSP theory and applications.
ECE 578 Fund of Computer Networks (3 units) is a graduate technical elective covering fundamental computer networking concepts.
ECE 574A Computer Aided Logic (3 units) is a technical elective focusing on computer-aided logic design.
ECE 566 Knowledge System Engineering (3 units) is an approved graduate technical elective on knowledge-based systems and engineering.
ECE 571 Fund Info Theory & Network security (3 units) is a graduate technical elective focusing on information theory and network security concepts.
